exercise: numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4]. Use the pop() method to remove the last element. Print both the removed element and the updated list.
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'orange']. Use pop() to remove and store the last fruit in a variable called 'removed_fruit'. Print the variable and the updated list.
colors = ['red', 'green', 'blue']. Use pop(0) to remove the first color. Print both the removed color and the updated list.
stack = ['task1', 'task2', 'task3']. Use pop() to simulate completing the most recent task. Print the completed task and the remaining tasks.
letters = ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']. Use pop(2) to remove the third element. Print the removed letter and the updated list.
queue = ['person1', 'person2', 'person3']. Use pop(0) to simulate serving the first person in line. Print who was served and who remains in the queue.
mixed_data = [10, 'hello', True, 3.14]. Use pop() to remove the last item. Print the removed item and the updated list.
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]. Use pop() to remove and store the last number. Then use pop(1) to remove the second number. Add these two numbers and print the result along with the updated list.
words = ['hello', 'world', 'python', 'programming']. Use pop() twice to remove the last two words. Print the removed words in reverse order of removal and the updated list.
data = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]. Use pop() to remove the last element, then use pop(-1) to remove what is now the last element. Print both removed values and the final list.
items = ['pen', 'pencil', 'paper', 'eraser']. Create a new list called 'selected_items' that contains the items at positions 1 and 2, removed using pop(). Print both lists.
values = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]. Use pop() to remove elements until the list has only two items left. Print each removed value and the final list.
prices = [9.99, 19.99, 29.99, 39.99]. Use pop() to remove the highest price, and pop(0) to remove the lowest price. Calculate the average of the remaining prices and print it.
coordinates = [(1, 2), (3, 4), (5, 6)]. Use pop(1) to remove the middle coordinate. Print the x and y values of the removed coordinate separately.
matrix = [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]]. Use pop() to remove the last row. Then use pop(0) on the matrix to remove the first row. Print the removed rows and the remaining matrix.
nested = [[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]]. Use pop(1) to remove the middle nested list. Then use pop() on the removed list to get its last element. Print the value and the updated nested list.
records = [{'name': 'Alice', 'age': 25}, {'name': 'Bob', 'age': 30}]. Use pop() to remove the last record. Print the name of the removed person and the updated list.
data = [10, [20, 30], 40]. Use pop(1) to remove the nested list. Then use pop(0) on this nested list to remove its first element. Print the removed element and both modified lists.

mixed = ['a', 1, 'b', 2, 'c', 3]. Create a new list of only numbers by using pop() repeatedly to remove all elements that are strings. Print both the new list of numbers and what remains of the original list.

structure = [['a', 'b'], [1, 2], [True, False]]. Use pop() to remove the last sublist. Then use pop(0) to remove the first sublist. Create a new flattened list containing all elements from the removed sublists. Print the new list and the updated structure.
